item.title: Only 58% of supporters of France's LFI party advocate for the immediate and unconditional recognition of a Palestinian state, a survey finds.
item.description:
Headline: 58% of LFI Supporters Advocate for Unconditional Recognition of a Palestinian State, Survey Reveals
Summary: As Emmanuel Macron postpones the conference intended to discuss the two-state solution in the Middle East, the majority of French citizens prefer a cautious approach to diplomatic initiatives.
item.content:encoded:
Headline: 58% of LFI Supporters Advocate for Unconditional Recognition of a Palestinian State, Survey Reveals
Summary: As Emmanuel Macron postpones the conference intended to discuss the two-state solution in the Middle East, the majority of French citizens prefer a cautious approach to diplomatic initiatives.

item.title: The Socialist Party in Lisbon requests an audit of the housing lottery.
item.description: Headline: Lisbon's Socialist Party Requests Independent Review of Housing Lottery Summary: The Socialist Party in Lisbon believes that an independent review is essential to enhance the credibility of the City Council, which has already initiated an internal investigation.
item.content:encoded: Headline: Lisbon's Socialist Party Requests Independent Review of Housing Lottery Summary: The Socialist Party in Lisbon believes that an independent review is essential to enhance the credibility of the City Council, which has already initiated an internal investigation.

item.title: Organisers of Notting Hill Carnival in the UK express concern about its continuation without timely financial support.
item.description: Headline: Notting Hill Carnival Organizers Seek Additional Funding for Future Events Summary: Ian Comfort, chair of the Notting Hill Carnival, has reached out to Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy to discuss the need for additional funding to support future carnival events.
item.content:encoded: Headline: Notting Hill Carnival Organizers Seek Additional Funding for Future Events Summary: Ian Comfort, chair of the Notting Hill Carnival, has reached out to Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy to discuss the need for additional funding to support future carnival events.

item.title: Report Details Greenhouse Gas Emissions Expected from Australia's North West Shelf Project
item.description:
**Headline:** Overview: Greenhouse Gas Emissions from the North West Shelf Project Extension
**Summary:** The North West Shelf gas project, located on the Burrup Peninsula in Western Australia and operated by Woodside, is one of the world's prominent liquified natural gas developments. In May, the project received government approval for an extension, allowing operations to continue from 2030 to 2070. The emissions related to this extension are categorized as scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions, as detailed in the Environmental Protection Authority application. These emissions contribute to the overall greenhouse gas output, alongside other sources such as domestic emissions from Qantas and the agricultural sector. Efforts are focused on understanding and managing these emissions, along with exploring potential mitigation strategies to address environmental impacts. For more information on the project and related emission data, please refer to the full Environmental Protection Authority report.
item.content:encoded:
**Headline:** Overview: Greenhouse Gas Emissions from the North West Shelf Project Extension
**Summary:** The North West Shelf gas project, located on the Burrup Peninsula in Western Australia and operated by Woodside, is one of the world's prominent liquified natural gas developments. item.title: Leaked letter indicates that the Notting Hill Carnival in the UK may need urgent funding to continue.
item.description:
**Headline:** Notting Hill Carnival Seeks Additional Government Funding for Continued Success
**Summary:** The organizers of the Notting Hill Carnival have reached out to the government for additional financial support to ensure the event's future prosperity. In a letter to the culture secretary, Ian Comfort, the chair of the carnival, emphasized the importance of public funding for the continuation of this culturally significant event.
item.content:encoded:
**Headline:** Notting Hill Carnival Seeks Additional Government Funding for Continued Success
**Summary:** The organizers of the Notting Hill Carnival have reached out to the government for additional financial support to ensure the event's future prosperity. In a letter to the culture secretary, Ian Comfort, the chair of the carnival, emphasized the importance of public funding for the continuation of this culturally significant event.

item.title: The Federal Reserve maintains interest rates despite President Trump's request for a reduction.
item.description:
Headline: Federal Reserve Maintains Interest Rates and Discusses Possible Future Adjustments
Summary: The Federal Reserve announced its decision to keep interest rates unchanged while indicating the possibility of two rate reductions later in the year. This comes as part of their regular economic assessments, taking into account current inflation projections and growth estimates. The announcement reflects ongoing analysis of economic conditions.
item.content:encoded:
Headline: Federal Reserve Maintains Interest Rates and Discusses Possible Future Adjustments
Summary: The Federal Reserve announced its decision to keep interest rates unchanged while indicating the possibility of two rate reductions later in the year. item.title: Temperatures in France are expected to reach 37°C in Paris and Bordeaux and 36°C in Lyon as the heatwave peaks on Saturday.
item.description:
Headline: Temperatures Expected to Reach 37°C in Paris and Bordeaux, 36°C in Lyon as Heatwave Peaks in France
Summary: This weekend, temperatures are anticipated to rise significantly across much of France, with a cooling trend and thunderstorms forecasted for Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Headline: Temperatures Expected to Reach 37°C in Paris and Bordeaux, 36°C in Lyon as Heatwave Peaks in France
Summary: This weekend, temperatures are anticipated to rise significantly across much of France, with a cooling trend and thunderstorms forecasted for Monday.
